eligibility:
10+2 level (Karnataka PUC, ISCE, CBSE, NIOS, other State Boards), and any recognized bodies in India. It is compulsory to have studied any two subjects – Biology (Botany/Zoology), Chemistry and Biotechnology, at the Class 12 th Level
Candidates writing the +2 examinations in March-May 2025 may apply with their class X and XI marks.
Students pursuing International curriculum must note that eligibility is according to AIU stipulations:
Applicants pursuing IB curriculum must have 3 HL and 3 SL with 24 credits.
Applicants pursuing GCE / Edexcel must have a minimum of 3 A levels with a grade not less than C.
why_choose: Why choose this course? Dynamic Fusion of Biotechnology and Zoology Studies Emphasis on Societal Impact and Holistic Understanding Practical Insights and Entry into the Fast-Growing Biotech Sector Diverse Foundational Knowledge and Skill Set Development Focus on Interdisciplinary Collaboration and Adaptive Skill Development Unique Blend of Hands On Learning & Cutting Edge Research Integration
what_learn: What you will learn? Microbiology, cell biology, and immunology fundamentals. Comprehensive knowledge of genetics and molecular biology. Advanced understanding of animal diversity and ecology. Specialized training in biotechnological techniques and applications. Proficiency in biostatistics and analytical methodologies in biology. Practical skills for environmental sustainability and bio-entrepreneurship.
modules: Modules Microbiology and animal diversity fundamentals. Introduction to environmental studies and holistic education. Basics of Biochemistry, Cell Biology, and Environment Sciences. Year 1 Practical lab experience in diverse biological fields. English language and multidisciplinary courses. Skill enhancement courses. Exposure to advanced topics in animal physiology, and functional ecology. English language advancement and multidisciplinary learning. Holistic education Year 2 In-depth study of genetics and evolution. Comprehensive understanding of immunology and molecular biology. Summer internship Comprehensive understanding of genetic engineering. Advanced study of animal breeding Exposure to advanced topics in reproductive and developmental biology Year 3 Exploration of Environmental Biotechnology, Animal Biotechnology and Bioprocess engineering Emphasis on vermitechnology, parasitology, aquatic and wildlife biology Summer internship Research Methodology, Data analysis, Computational Biology Medical Biotechnology, Disease Biology, Omics studies Fungal Biotechnology and Applied plant physiology Year 4 Industrial Microbiology, Biophysics Bio-entrepreneurship
career: Career prospects Biotechnologist in research and development. Environmental conservationists in sustainable practices. Zoologist specializing in wildlife and ecology. Bioinformatics specialist in data analysis. Laboratory technician in advanced analytical methodologies. Entrepreneur in biotechnology and ecological solutions.
